channel.title: Home on Melissa K. Spencer
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Melissa K. Spencer

item.title: Safer Sex?
item.description: The Effect of AIDS Risk on Birth Rates May 5, 2020 Abstract The advent of HIV/AIDS in the 1980s dramatically increased the cost of contracting a sexually transmitted infection (STI). Prior research shows that people responded to the AIDS epidemic by switching to sexual behaviors and contraceptive methods with lower likelihood of AIDS transmission. These behavioral adjustments also affect the likelihood of pregnancy and the incidence of other STIs. This paper provides evidence that the AIDS epidemic increased the birth rate among adult women by as much as 1.

item.title: A published paper

item.title: Working Paper
